job_title: Supply Associate in Abuja, Federal Capital Territory
pros: Strong systems and passionate about what they do. Futuristic and technology driven in a good way for a UN organization.
cons:
Still struggles to reshape or remove some legacy staff that are now dead weight.
Can sometimes be difficult to grow in the organization, if you do not socialize well enough.

job_title: Editor in Abuja, Federal Capital Territory
pros: Flexible work plans that suits all staff and comfortable environments that would make people want to stay for a long time.
cons: There is a need for expansion and more digital presence that will increase the visibility of the corporation in certain places.

review_title: Great place if you love children
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Abuja, Federal Capital Territory
pros: It aspires to ideals that can make you stay.  Women also get 6 months maternity leave with full pay. UNICEF puts its money where its mouth is.
cons: Because it works in the spirit of the Paris Principles of Aid Effectiveness, which demands you align with government and work through government systems, bureaucracy can dampen your spirit here sometimes.
